* Duke is a task list manager for tasks, deadlines and events!
* @param filepath This is the filepath where the data file duke.txt would be stored.
* This method sets up the classes that Duke is reliant on.
* @param args No arguments required in the CLI
public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
* The Parser class parses inputs for the Duke program. The Parser takes in inputs from the user and executes

* @param taskList Takes in a TaskList for the Parser to call methods for.

* adding and deleting tasks, and finding tasks.

* @return Returns a boolean to let the Duke program know whether the user has given instructions to terminate.

* The Storage class helps the Duke program store its list of tasks into a file specified by the program.
* The Storage class also reads from a .txt file and converts the text into an ArrayList of Tasks.

* The TaskList class is a class to store Tasks. The TaskList has methods to add, delete, mark, unmark
* Tasks and to print the whole TaskList.
* Stores the Tasks in an ArrayList.
* Stores the number of tasks currently.
* Constructor to create a TaskLIst when no previous data is available.
* Overlaoded onstructor to create a TaskList when previous data is found.
* @param taskList Takes in an ArrayList of Tasks loaded from previous use.
* Getter for a task at a specific position.

* Getter for the tasks added by the user.
* Getter for the number of tasks added by the user.
System.out.println(SPACING + "Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println(SPACING + "Now you have " + Integer.toString(numTasks) + " tasks in the list.\n");
* Marks a task at the specified position to be done.
* @param position Position of task to be marked.
System.out.println(SPACING + "Nice! I have marked this task as done:");
* Marks a task at the specified position to be not done.
* @param position Position of the task to be unmarked.
System.out.println(SPACING + "Nice! I have marked this task as undone:");
* Deletes the task at the specified position from the TaskList.
* @param position Position of the task to be deleted.
System.out.println(SPACING + "List empty. Add tasks into your list!\n");
System.out.println(SPACING + "Now you have " + Integer.toString(numTasks) + " tasks in the list.\n");
* Searches for tasks in the tasklist containing the keyword.

System.out.println(SPACING + "Here are the matching tasks in your list:");

* The Ui class interacts with the user and is responsible for the formatting of the printed texts. The Ui class also
* greets the user and asks for inputs until terminated.
* Constant for the spacing to be printed out for line separation.
* BufferedReader to read in inputs from the user.
* Greets the user when the program is started.
System.out.println("What do you need help with?");
* Prints a spacing before Duke gives an output.
* Prints a spacing after Duke gives an output.
* Says bye to the user when the program is terminated.
* Trigger the BufferedReader to ask for inputs from the user.
* @return Returns a the user input in the form of a String literal.
* The Deadline class is a subclass of Task that has a due date and an optional due time.
* Stores the due date of the Deadline task.
* Stores the due time (if any) of the Deadline task.
* Constructor of Deadline class when there is no due time for the Deadline task.
* @param description Description of the Deadline task.
* @param dueDate Due date of the Deadline task.
* Overloaded constructor of Deadline class when there is a due time for the Deadline task.
* @param description Description of the Deadline class.
* @param dueDate Due date of the Deadline task.
* @param dueTime Due time of the Deadline task.
public Deadline(String description, String dueDate, String dueTime) {
* Getter for the due date and due time (if any) of the Deadline task.
* Returns a String literal "D" for the Task type.
* Overrides the parent class Task's toString() method to include its Task type, due date and due time.
* The Event class is a subclass of Task that has a date and time for the Event to occur at.
* Stores the date of the event.
* Stores the time of the event
public Event(String description, String eventDate, String eventTime) {
* Getter for the Event date and Time
* Returns a String literal "E" for the Task type.
* Overrides the parent class Task's toString() method to include its Task type and Event date and time.
* The Task class serves as a class to be extended by other classes of tasks.
* @param description The task description is stored as a String.
* @param isDone Tracks if Task is done. Set to false when Tasks are initialised.
* Gets the status of the Task.
* @return Returns a String, a space if Task is not done, and X otherwise.
* Alternate method to check if task is done. Used by other classes.
* @return Returns a String, 0 if Task is not done, and 1 otherwise.
* Sets the done status of the Task.
* @param status Takes in a 0 to set Task to not done, and any other integer to set as done.
* Unused method to be overwritten by subclasses of Task with deadlines.
* @return Returns an empty String as it is not used.
* Unused method to be overwritten by subclasses of Task to return the class of Task they are.
* @return Returns an empty String as it is not used.
* Overrides the default toString() method of Object.
* @return Returns the Task description and its status.
* The Todo class represents tasks to be done, but without a specific deadline or time to be done,
* and is thus the most basic class of tasks.
* @param description Takes in the description of the Todo task.
* Returns a String literal "T" for the Task type.
* Overrides the parent class Task's toString() method to include its Task type.
